name: Serrano Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: Found this hotel with a great review on travelzoo.com when it was going for $100 a night - definitely a steal!
reviews.title: Loved the free wine!

reviews.text: My sister and I enjoyed the complimentary wine bar from 5-6. They were very generous pourers, and we quickly found ourselves talking to the other guests and sharing stories and tips about the city.
reviews.title: Great location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were a little on the small side, but comfy, especially the beds and the down comforters and pillows! Aveda ammenities were also a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great price/location

likes.disliked: — Outrageous fees to use the internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If breakfast is not included in the rate, I suggest skipping the hotel's b-fast and head out to one of the many dinners on your walk to union square. It will cost you less.
reviews.title: Great Start!!! Would go again.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great and not too noisy. There is a section near the hotel that you shouldn't cross into at night, but we didn't have any trouble.
reviews.title: Serrano was absolutely perfect

reviews.text: Every December I meet friends for a girls' weekend in San Francisco. We usually get rooms on Priceline, but this year decided that location took precedence and looked for a good rate on a hotel near Union Square. We found a wonderful rate through hotels.com for the Serrano Hotel, which is a Kimpton property. Knowing Kimpton's reputation and noting the fantastic location we decided to give the hotel a try and are we glad we did!
reviews.title: A great little gem for a fantastic price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some reviews here suggest that the area is too criminal or threatening, esp. for women traveling by themselves, but we came and went after dark and never once felt threatened or afraid. We weren't even nervous. The Hilton and Nikko hotel are right around the corner and walking to and from Union Square along O'farrell is absolutely fine. Yes, you might be asked for change by someone along the way, but that can happen on almost any street downtown.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Hotel in San Francisco!

likes.liked: — Value, Quiet, Friendliness of Staff, Location, Cleanliness of Room, Size of Bathroom
likes.disliked: — Parking Expensive, No coffee pot in room, Wireless internet only in lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was an easy walk from the BART station on Powell. The lobby is very cute and the decor for Christmas cheery. At the front desk, play a hand of blackjack with the clerk and if you win, you pick from a list of daily prizes (we got a bottle of wine delivered to the room). If you lose, donate to their animal charity. Check-in was fast. The elevators are tiny and on the slow side, but not annoyingly so.
reviews.title: Serrano - a convenient haven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had rooms with two doubles. The rooms are very small, but nicely decorated. Love the ipod docking alarm clock/radio, the down comforters and comfy beds. The flat panel TV was a nice touch also. The closet had ample room with iron/ironing board, plenty of hangers and cheetah-print robes for guest use.
reviews.title: A Jewel
Serrano Hotel San Francisco
reviews.text: The bathroom again, was very tiny but well-stocked with Aveda bath amenities (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and two kinds of soap). I love not having to pack extra toiletries, so having nice products is a big plus. There is no counter space to speak of, but there is a narrow shelf running the length of the mirror. Enough room for toothbrushes, etc. The shower is really high on the wall, perfect for tall people. The water pressure is fine.

reviews.title: Had a great time at the Serrano
reviews.text: We spent a long weekend at the Serrano before flying home from a trip through Wine Country.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone on the staff was courteous and helpful and the hotel itself was charming and well-cared-for.
reviews.title: Good find!

likes.disliked: — the squeaking lift during the day!

reviews.text: The complimentary wine reception was a great opportunity to relax and socialize between a day of walking and exploring and an evening of great dining.
reviews.title: Wonderful, more than I even expected, experience at the Serrano

reviews.text: The location was perfect, we dropped off our rental car the first day and walked everywhere. At no time did we feel uncomfortable in the area surrounding the hotel, even walking to and from local restaurants each evening.
reviews.title: Very Impressed with everything.

reviews.text: We would highly recommend the Serrano as a great place to stay while visiting San Francisco.
reviews.title: Much better than expected

likes.liked: — Comfort and style. Clean and clubby. Charmingly relaxing setting. Coffee and Wine in lobby!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel - excellent service from the time of check in till check out. We stayed for 4 days in August and had no problems. Rooms are typical for boutique, but you are there to see the city/area, not to hang out in the hotel room. Very clean, comfortable beds, Aveda bath products. Daily excellent coffee, wine at night. They make you very comfortable and I only paid $140/night, which I thought was an excellent value. I would strongly recommend the hotel - its at the border between Tenderloin and Union Sq, but it was very safe outside and close to the BART.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Serrano. I was there on business and had a wonderful three night stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. I had a suite and both the bedroom and the sitting room were nice sized, and nicely decorated. The only drawback to the Serrano was the bathroom. It was clean, but there was no place to put anything--no counter at all. I had to keep everything in the bedroom on the table and carry in my toothbrush, etc. for use in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

likes.disliked: — The bathroom--too small and no counters.

reviews.text: The restaurant in the hotel is fantastic. Great service and asian fusion fare made from the freshest ingredients. I ate there two nights of the three I was in town.
reviews.title: Nice Room, Poor Service

likes.disliked: — expensive breakfast involving pleading for coffee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really like old buildings and converted or restored hotels, and the Serrano is a great example.
reviews.title: Great boutique Hotel

likes.disliked: — Still a few remnants of skid row on some ornes even though it;s a trendy theatre district now.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every morning there was fresh coffee and every evening a wine reception.
reviews.title: The Most Hospitable Hotel We've Ever Stayed At
Great Little Hotel!
reviews.text: This is a good hotel in a great location. Yes the rooms are small but for the price you cannot expect large rooms. The staff are helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Great stay at Serrano!
reviews.text: Arrived for a week long vacation. Impressive lobby, complimentary wine served every afternoon. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was small, but comfortable and modern. Very small bathroom, but we made it work. If you're staying with someone else, you need ot be able to get along well in cramped quarters! Excellent restaurant downstairs with good service. Great value for your dough. Good location near Union Square - 2 blocks from cable car, 1 block from National rental car office, park next door for best rate. Front desk even printed our boarding pass for our flight early the next morning. Busy location on the fringe of a questionable neighborhood with many homeless people. New mattresses for all of the beds were arriving during our stay. We would definitely recommend the Serrano!
It was just a one-night trip, visiting friends. I had no choice, since it was booked via Priceline the day before.
reviews.title: Small, small, small!

likes.liked: — The IPOD alarm clock, the bed, the fitness center
likes.disliked: — Room was small, location not the best, checkout not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off the positives in no particular order: IPOD alarm clock, plush bed and linens, tastefully decorated.
reviews.title: Nice For the Price

reviews.text: Lastly in no particular order: Mini frig, even though it's inside the TV armoire, was particularly noisy. The key for the minibar was broken, so I'm not sure an employee or a previous guest ate or drank something.
reviews.title: Horrible Experience

likes.liked: — Establishment itself was nice, as far as decor.

reviews.text: We've stayed at many hotels in SF, and this is one I look forward to staying at often. World class service from the door man to the ladies working the floors, and unbelievable five star experience with the front desk. If I knew the gentleman's name working the desk early evening of 9/1/8, I would lavish him with praise. He really made our stay a special experience. Highly Recommend this hotel for San Francisco luxury at an affordable price, great location near shopping, dining, cable cars... Excellent opportunity for business travelers, family vacations, and they even accept pets, we saw beautiful little dogs with their happy companions. Beds are float in the clouds comfortable, can't say enough good things about the Serrano, play the check in game and donate to your favorite charity!! Thank you Serrano & Hotwire for showing the way...
reviews.title: FIVE STAR SERVICE, Great Getaway at the Serrano

likes.liked: — World Class Five Star Luxury SERVICE
likes.disliked: — I couldn't take the bed with me...

reviews.text: We stayed five days at the Serrano making it a long labor day weekend. The hotel was very busy but operations were smooth. It is an excellent place to bring a little child - the crib was brought in no time to the room and we had a high-chair in the room for the entire duration of our stay. The room was very quiet, we were lucky to be on the 15th floor where we almost couldn't hear the traffic down there.
reviews.title: Everything our little family needed at Serrano

likes.disliked: — price of the minibar and restaurant

reviews.text: It's true that the standard room we had was on the small side but it was OK for the three of us. The restaurant (Ponzu) where breakfast is served is OK but not so much my style and rather expensive. San Fran has better places if you go out there! Also be aware of the minibar: it's full of goodies but no free lunch!
reviews.title: Luke Warm About Serrano

reviews.text: Location is very convenient with easy access to the city (we walked to Fisherman's on the first day) and public transport on Market Street and the shops. If you take Powell Street to go to Market St you can avoid the Tenderloin area which I'd advise
reviews.title: Close to Cable Car and Shopping

likes.liked: — shopping and cable car closeby, restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me start by saying that the staff at the Serrano was wonderful! The door man greeted us each day by name and the concierge was most helpful in giving us information regarding city. The hotel is centrally located to Union square which makes catching the trolley to all other sites (i.e. China town, Fisherman's Wharf) easy, however, if you go 1 block down and to the east of the hotel you will be overcome by Homeless people. This made me feel extremely uncomfortable and is definetely something I'm not accustomed to seeing while on vacation. The rooms are really small. As my husband said, "I can't even change my mind in this room let alone my clothes". And the closet smelled bad. We stayed 3 nights and I have to confess that I was excited to move on to our next hotel. I wish I would have listened to my husband, gone for modern, and stayed in the Financial District instead of being sucked into the charm of a bygone era.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Booked the hotel through Hotelopia as there was a great rate for a 4 night stay that brought the cost of this hotel down to just over £50 per night for 2 people. Breakfast was not included but that was no problem as the hotel is situated one block away from the fabulous Pinecrest Diner (recommended) and Lori's diner which both served excellent varied breakfast menus. The standard room (double double) is a very good size and immaculate with a good size bathroom, sat tv and minibar. The hotel in general was spotless and the staff friendly and I cannot fault it.
reviews.title: Great location and high standards

reviews.text: The location of the hotel makes it ideal for getting around and the trams for all the routes you need are close by. The major shops you need are all within 2 blocks most notably Old Navy, Bloomingdales, Nordstrom, Barneys and a fabulous Macy's are all within ten mins walk maximum.
reviews.title: Charming !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I visit again and can get the hotel for the same bargain price I would definetly stay here again. For the price it left everything in the same price range standing and made the stay extremely comfortable even if the beds were a bit soft!!
reviews.title: Give the Serrano a chance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent 4 nights in San Francisco with my family, and we all wanted to have a nice hotel / nice location. The travel agent advised me Union Square (fabulous for shopping & restaurants!) and the Serrano Hotel, saying she personnaly spent 2 nights there. Great choice ! the staff is friendly and everybody always had a smile or a nice word during our stay. Warm atmosphere with mediterranean influences (spanish I would say)... Rooms are great size for 4 people in, nice bathrooms, well appointed. They serve morning tea and coffee in the lobby, and even if I don't travel with my doggy, I heard the hotel is a pet friendly... Concierge service is fantastic, always a good address to recommand, and there is an indoor asian restaurant, seems to be a trendy place ! You can walk any direction from here, everything you need is around, and cable car line is just 3 blocks away. I will remember this charming hotel for my next stay in town...!
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: I'm actually sitting in my room at the Serrano as I write this review. We've stayed here for the past three nights during our first trip to San Francisco, and we've really enjoyed our stay. When we arrived Saturday night in the pouring rain, our cab was promptly greeted by a doorman with a huge umbrella and a luggage cart. Check in was smooth, and the front desk clerk could not have been nicer giving us maps and a layout of the city. I will admit that the location of this property is on the edge of a bad neighborhood, but the front desk is helpful in telling you where NOT to go to avoid the worst part. Our room is small, but I expected that, so I wasn't disappointed. The bed is super comfortable: fluffy, clean, white comforter and fluffy pillows. The bathroom is marble with a sizeable tub with shower. Water pressure is fabulous. Aveda shampoo, conditioner and lotion is a nice touch. Towels are soft and monogrammed with an "S". The one problem with the bathroom is that you can't really sit straight on the toilet since it is so close to the wall.Cheetah bathrobes hanging in the closet and the toys and games they have in the mini bar area are just a fun idea. I goofed off with the etch-a-sketch for a while and my husband is still threatening to "walk the dog" with the yoyo. There is a safe and free internet access (wired, not wireless) and the items in the mini bar were not as ridiculously priced as some I've experienced in the past. Really good coffee is available in the lobby from 5am to 10am, and we didn't make it to the wine/beer reception, but they have that daily from 5 to 6. We got in late and ate dinner at the attached restaurant, "Ponzu" which was pricey but good with average service. All in all, it's been a really great experience. Every time we come back in, we're greeted with, "Welcome back!" and we've been happy to be back.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm usually very cynical about hotels and don't typically write to praise a hotel. This hotel breaks the mold and has impressed me to the point of writing a positive review.
reviews.title: Incredible Stay

likes.liked: — The staff. Also, the room was very comfortable and nice
likes.disliked: — Toilet seat that would not remain up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was incredibly friendly and professional: from the concierge acknowledgment to us as we walked in to the bellman remembering our names throughout the entire stay...we truly felt important. The rooms were very clean with plenty of room and plenty of amenities.
reviews.title: Very Cool

reviews.text: The staff was incredibly helpful with great food recommendations that were both affordable and close. They also were helpful in general San Francisco information.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: This hotel bumps up against the tenderloin area, but I would never have guessed that there was ever any danger. My wife and i never once felt that we were in a threatening or uncomfortable situation concerning our safety.
reviews.title: Consistently Kimpton

likes.disliked: — that they didn't honor a AAA discount

reviews.text: My only complaint with the hotel is minor in that the toilet seat would not stay up as I tried to use the restroom...my wife found this trick useful :).
reviews.title: Good hotel for the adventuresome

likes.liked: — Bed was the most comforable of our 10 day trip.

reviews.text: Great Hotel. We were traveling with my stepdaughter & this hotel offered a suite with a King & a fold-out Queen sleeper. Had a drape that we could close between the rooms.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Location, adequate amount of bed for 3 people, large room, atmosphere
likes.disliked: — halls & elevator were small. It's an old hotel that has been completely re-done.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two armoires with TVs, huge bath with steam shower. Jacuzzi bath was another option.
reviews.title: Liked the Hotel and Staff

likes.liked: — The staff is very nice. They really made us feel welcome.
likes.disliked: — Our room, 1215, was very, very small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location near Union Square, but next to the border of bum town.
reviews.title: Did not meet expectations ......

reviews.text: Free wine happy hour from 5-6 daily in the lobby was fun way to meet other guests.
reviews.title: Good Location, needs a facelift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful beds & pillows. Only negative, our room had no view. However, we got a decent rate because of that.
reviews.title: Stop Looking and Book Here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a nice stay here. You can't beat the location, right in the heart of the city, near all sorts of great restaurants and dive bars. As with many hotels in the city, the rooms can be a bit small, but ours was clean and well appointed. The staff were friendly and helpful and the free wine reception in the lobby was a nice touch. I think it was a little pricey, but I'd stay again.
reviews.title: Comfy boutique hotel

reviews.text: I booked this hotel blind on Hotwire base on location and star rating only. While my wife wasn't pleased with the hotel decoration or the size of the rooms it was very comfortable.
reviews.title: In the middle of everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say that the best thing of the Serrano is its location. Everything you need to do or go is near by or just a hop from a bus, train or street car away.
reviews.title: Nice European Style Hotel

reviews.text: If you want a lavish hotel with impressive rooms, and lots of amenities then this might fall short of your expectations.  If you're looking for a comfortable place to sleep after a long day of sightseeing that is near everywhere you might want to go then this is a nice choice.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, handy location if a bit shady...

reviews.text: This is a quaint hotel. Not exactly what most American's would expect in a high-priced hotel, but very European. The room we stayed in (412) is quite small and the bathroom is large enough for only one person. The bed was not very comfortable - it was on the soft side and I felt as though I was sliding down the bed. The sheets were very soft and comfortable though they short-sheet the bed (flat sheets, not fitted), so my feet were always catching on the bottom edge of the sheet and feeling the mattress cover which was quite rough. The bathroom door is not hung level, so swings open and hits the toilet. The refrigerator made a loud noise, and when I checked it, it wasn't even cold, so I shut it off. There is no view except that of the parking garage from this room. Avoid the very over-priced honor bar - one small bottle of water is $4 and a bag of M&Ms is $5! Those are the two items we bought with our complimentary $10 allocation. They did have free wi-fi if you sign up for their rewards program - which we had to do twice because, though we signed up days in advance, when we went to sign in they had no record of us. Also, the desk has no way top look up your membership! The bar/restaurant next door is VERY loud and carries over into the hotel lobby. All in all - looks are very nice, but deep down, this is just an average quaint hotel not worthy of the prices/
reviews.title: Sept. 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our finale hotel of our trip and we were very happy with our room. The staff were great and very helpful, the hotel is in a great location almost on top of great shopping.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We were on the 17th floor and our room was clean and comfy. We had a cupboard full of odds bit and pieces which you could buy, there were things like a mini etch a sketch, playing cards and lots of other odd and fun bits. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.
reviews.title: A highlight of our vacation

reviews.text: We loved the wine tasting in the evening the hotel put on, the wines were of a very high standard.
reviews.title: Great located hotel

reviews.text: Frisco is a great city
reviews.title: good location and pleasant hotel

reviews.text: I booked our stay through Hotwire, and was excited to find that we'd be spending 5 nights in this beautiful hotel. I'd read through the many positive reviews for the Serrano - and was most impressed by J.P's personal responses to the majority of them. I emailed him to comment on that, and also mentioned that it was a special trip for us (my wife and I's bday, and first trip since we had our daughter 15 months ago.) When we checked in, there was a personal note from the staff wishing us happy birthday, along with a bottle of wine for us and applesauce for our little girl - waiting in a beautiful suite on the 17th floor. The view was lovely, the room perfect for a little girl who loves to run around, and the bed left us wishing we could take it home. Every member of the staff were so friendly, and no one even complained when we enjoyed the wine hour while our daughter made new friends with the other guests. It really made our trip fantastic. Thanks everyone - we'll definitely be back.
reviews.title: Great service, comfortable stay

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location for the good shopping of San Francisco, and is only a few blocks from the famous cable car. it also is very close to the subway and streetcar to access other parts of the city. There are many restaurants close by.
reviews.title: Great location, great service

reviews.text: The hotel is very welcoming, and the free wine hour every day goes down a treat. The room had everything I needed but felt a little small (quite common in San Fran). Although an old hotel it has been refurbished with modern rooms, with very small bathrooms, and also has a nice gym area.
reviews.title: Very Surprised Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for people wanting to stay where the action is with great access to Fisherman's Wharf.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: When in SF I usually stay at either the Marriott or Hilton. Both hotels just mentioned were booked and we ended up at the Serrano....I was prepared for the worst. Boy was I mistaken. Upon entering they have a very nicely done lobby...they were serving wine and beer free to the guest of the hotel...nice touch...also this is done daily from 5pm to 6pm. Check-in was routine and headed to my room on the 8th floor. I had a corner room. Upon entering it was clean and updated....not very big...but your in the wrong city if you plan on staying in your room too much...there is much to do in SF. The bathroom was clean and the shower head was at least 8ft up the wall.....I notice these things because I am a mid 6 footer.....and great water pressure by the way. I never ate in the hotel....too many great restaurants to go to. Be sure to eat at Dotties when in SF....it is just around the corner to your right....up 1 block on Jones street. Look at Trip Advisor comments about Dotties True Blue Cafe....its a great place to eat. When returning to SFO I will definitely keep the Serrano in mind.....very pleased with my stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco

reviews.text: Very nice hotel, great room, small bathroom. Very nice staff. Bed and linens excellent, close to everything but questionnable neighborrood...
reviews.title: It did the trick! Clean and Comfortable...but a little cramped.
Great Location--Even Better Bed
reviews.text: The Serrano is part of the Kimpton boutique chain. All related hotels host evening wine/beer hours in the lobby, which is a very nice perk.

Check-in was unbelievably smooth. I had been staying at another Kimpton (Hotel Triton) earlier in the week and checked out at noon before walking the 1/3 mile to the Serrano. I fully expected to not be able to check in, but I had hoped to at least leave my luggage before heading out again. Much to my surprise, I was greeted warmly and given my preferred room immediately.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Serrano

reviews.text: My room was on the 12th floor and had a so-so view east of Union Square. My room was wonderful--decadently comfortable queen sized bed, sufficent armoire and tv, and decent bathroom with bath/shower combo and Aveda products. The rooms aren't large, but you are hard-pressed to find large rooms in the middle of San Francisco. The room was spotless and was immaculately tended to each morning by housekeeping.
reviews.title: Comfortable Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a member of the loyalty program with Kimpton, which includes a "gift" upon each arrival. When I arrived to my room, I found a 16 oz. bottle of spring water and a small box of Napa-produced truffles. Very nice touch.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge assisted me twice--once to arrange shuttle transportation to the airport and another time to make reservations for my party at a nearby restaurant. Each time, Chad was most gracious and helpful.
reviews.title: Sin in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed 3 nights at The Fairmont on Nob Hill, we moved here for 2 nights and loved it.
reviews.title: Ace Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great. Whilst a few people say its a bit dodgy I wouldn't hesitate to recommend and we found it fun and refreshing and so close to Union Square etc.
reviews.title: Just what you want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were really great, helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: Very Small room

reviews.text: The room was on the 7th floor and a king deluxe. It was moderate in size but as we were travelling light it was perfect and clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great location

reviews.text: First off, when you book a room, the preferences you select don't actually mean anything. We booked a two bed smoking room, and when we arrived, were told that they could not accommodate us. Great.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service

reviews.text: So we go up to the room. Seems ok. I start to unpack and find a pair of dirty undies in the closet. I go downstairs, and they tell me there is nothing they can do because the hotel is completely sold out for the night. I demand some sort of compensation and am basically called a liar by the manager on duty.
reviews.title: Great location, small room, superb staff. V Happy

reviews.text: We booked via Hotwire.com so got a rate around $120 a night. And for that, it was superb. The hotel is lovely, the lobby great, the free wine - a nice perk, the staff, all of them, 100% fantastic.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We suffered no problems with noise. The panhandlers seem a common feature of SF and none were aggressive. To be honest, all my memories of the panhandlers are of charming people trying to charm a few cents off you (I went outside for smokes frequently so met a fair few of them lol)
reviews.title: Had a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I'd say is that if I'd paid rack rates for the same Queen room I'd have been very miffed at $299 - the room was as small as could be. It was lovely, and worked well, but put it this way, if you have your TV cabinet doors extended, you can't get from one side of the bed to the other. Not a problem, but not worth 300 bucks in my mind. Saying that - it probably is for central SF.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice boutique hotel located close to Union Square. The rooms were typically small but very clean and updated. The beds were very comfortable - we slept like babies. The hotel has an adjacent bar which is handy and free internet. The fact it cost about $225 a night during the high season seemed very reasonable to me. No complaints whatsoever. My only recommendation - when leaving the hotel, don't head West along O'Farrell Ave. It got pretty seedy very quickly.
reviews.title: Really good value in San Francisco

reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Priceline. Never been to San Fran before so had no Idea what to expect. I figure the hotel was as easy to find as anything else in the city. Very helpful when we checked in. Garage right next door took care of the car. Bell hop was friendly and full of info. We asked for a double room because our son was unexpectedly with us. They were sold out of doubles and extra single rooms. He said he could upgrade us to a suite for what I felt was a reasonable up charge. The hotel was very charming and I loved the room. View was. Commanding and I enjoyed our stay here. We stayed two nights and the location was great.
reviews.title: Great stay in San Fran

reviews.text: This is a Kimpton hotel property (Hotel Monaco). Kimpton hotels are always good. They treat you with respect and kindness.
reviews.title: Kimpton hotels are always good
Great hotel...
reviews.text: The rooms are a bit small, but just fine for one business traveler. They are clean and current.
Tip: ask for a coffee maker to be sent to your room. No charge and it is better than going down-stairs each morning.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel just off Union Square

description: The Serrano Hotel elegantly embodies the spirit of San Francisco. Housed in a beautifully restored 17-story Spanish revival building, this welcoming boutique hotel provides an extraordinary and engaging focal point for an unforgettable stay. In the center of the city, the Serrano Hotel is within easy reach of Union Square, Moscone Convention Center, the Financial District and San Francisco's best theaters and shops. Adjacent to the Serrano Hotel is the lively Jasper's Corner Tap & Kitchen.
